'''Shape Your World: A Minecraft Story''' is a live action short film themed after the [[Chase the Skies]] [[game drop]]. Released on the {{w|International Day of Friendship}}, the video tells the story of two teenagers named Sally and Sully who are separated, but are able to reconnect through video games.<ref>{{Citation|url=https://www.linkedin.com/posts/the-boo-agency_shape-your-world-a-minecraft-story-celebrating-activity-7356375398986719232-ZyJx?utm_source=share&utm_medium=member_desktop&rcm=ACoAADdy8wsBcTksodH13v_sRKlptiHH1ZyFhRI|title=Celebrating International Day of Friendship by introducing the world to the short story of Sully & Sally.<br><br>Because when you miss your friend, just* add water.<br><br>Minecraft is more than a vast creative sandbox, itâ€™s a whole world of stories waiting to be discovered. We LOVED telling this one.|author=[https://www.linkedin.com/company/the-boo-agency/posts?lipi=urn%3Ali%3Apage%3Ad_flagship3_detail_base%3BjEcBH7%2FMSp%2BuPVnOIdjp9g%3D%3D Boo Agency]|website=LinkedIn|date=July 30, 2025}}</ref><ref name=":designrush">{{Citation|url=https://news.designrush.com/minecraft-boo-agency-shape-your-world|title=Minecraft Builds On Emotional Storytelling With Live-Action Friendship Film|author=[https://www.designrush.com/author/roberto-orosa Roberto Orosa]|website=DesignRush|date=August 22, 2025}}</ref> Unlike other Minecraft short films, it is primarily live action, with stylized cinematography and practical effects such as puppets.

Following the release of the film, additional [[Mojang shorts|shorts]] featuring Sully and his ghast were produced.<ref>{{Citation|url=https://www.boo-agency.com/work/shape-your-world|title=Shape Your World|website=Boo Agency}}</ref><ref>{{YouTube link|A301V6BZG5Y|YEAH THAT'S THE ONE!|Minecraft|August 6, 2025}}</ref><ref>{{Cite TikTok|minecraft|7535502948269346079|Daily hydration reminder ðŸ’§#shapeyourworld|August 6, 2025}}</ref>

== Summary ==
A boy named Sully says goodbye to his girlfriend, Sally, whose parents are moving away to {{Wikipedia|Australia}}, both incredibly saddened by the situation. As Sully retreats into his room and sulks, he decides to play ''[[Minecraft]]'', apparently on [[Christmas]]. As he sees a present chest, he's reminded of a gift Sally had given him, realizing it's a [[dried ghast]]. He takes it into the bathroom and hydrates it with the sink, discovering it's a real, living [[ghastling]]. As it flies up into the air, it makes a mess of the room and flies out the window.

An unknown amount of time later, the creature has matured into a [[happy ghast]], Sully somehow having crafted a [[harness]]. As he prepares for a journey, he sneaks in wearing a bathrobe and hesitates before jumping out the bathroom window. Together, the ghast takes the boy on a ride through the clouds, all the way down under. Flying above the desert, the boy calls out to Sally, who is relieved to see that her idea worked. The two join each other on the ghast, and fly off into the sky.

== Trivia ==

* At one point, text appears on screen saying "don't jump from windows onto mounts in real life. It's a Minecraft thing." This is a callback to a similar gag in [[Minecraft: Shape Your World]], where a disclaimer was given for using a [[water bucket]] to survive a fall.
* Travelling from Stockholm to Australia in a straight line (a distance of approximately 12,500 km or 7,700 miles at least) using a [[happy ghast]] with the in-game [[Transportation#Methods|speed of 3.5 m/s]] would take more than 40 (real-life) days.
* The short was primarily made using practical effects, with minimal CGI and no generative AI.<ref name=":designrush" />
